description: From over- +‎ give. Compare Scots overgie (“to relinquish, resign”), Dutch overgeven (“to surrender”), German übergeben (“to hand over, surrender”), Danish overgive (“to surrender”).

verbs.description: overgive (third-person singular simple present overgives, present participle overgiving, simple past overgave, past participle overgiven)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To give over, hand over, surrender; to relinquish. [from 15th c.]
(obsolete, transitive) To give up, terminate. [16th–17th c.]
